channel.title: [Help] Need more help with Ubuntu Linux
channel.description:
Omg this is so hard.
I have been reading guides and everything and I can't seem to get firestarter to work. I opened up Terminal and I put in the right code and it said that the package wasn't available. I'm not sure how to install anything.
I don't know how to install firefox extensions.
Does anyone have a guide on how to do everything on Ubuntu Linux??
Ubuntu Linux is supposed to have Windows emulation right? I'm soooo lost. Please help.

item.title: [Help] Need more help with Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Thats what I typed in Xerxes.

Like I said before...
and it said that the package wasn't available

Do you know if I can download the package or something? Also thank you for the guides, but I've read them all lol. When I wanna do something, I wanna do it right. This is the only exception lol.

And afi. To make a drive D, or any extra drive for that matter, you just need to make a partition. I got another program if you're interested. I'll add it to the free programs list.

Read full topic
item.source: [Help] Need more help with Ubuntu Linux

item.title: [Help] Need more help with Ubuntu Linux
item.dc:creator: @Xerxes Xerxes
item.description:
@Xerxes wrote:

http://ubuntuguide.org/ ?
http://help.ubuntu.com/starterguide/C/faqguide-all.html ?

Firestarter is maintained in Debian and can be downloaded and installed using the apt-get tool by simply typing "apt-get install firestarter".

Ubuntu users can install Firestarter by enabling the "universe" repository in the /etc/apt/sources.list file or in synaptic under Settings->Repositories. Having enabled the repository, the procedure is the same as in Debian.

Read full topic
